context: The Estonian adjective 'fantastiline' means 'fantastic' in English. It can be used to describe something as wonderful, amazing, or great. According to the dictionary, it has two main meanings: 1) based on fantasy, imaginary, unreal, supernatural - like a fantastic image, creature, or fairy tale world; 2) unbelievably large, magnificent - referring to dimensions, speed, achievements, beauty etc. The word can be modified for different grammatical cases (genitive, partitive) and has comparative and superlative forms.
